vocabulary.definition: To apply a method
Anything, especially a synthetic substance but also any substance (e.g. sulfur), or virus, bacterium, or other organism, which kills or suppresses the activities of pests.
Artificial product

vocabulary.meaning: gia tăng về số lượng, kích cỡ, tầm quan trọng
vocabulary.definition: To change (something) from a smaller form and/or size to a larger one; to spread out or lay open.
vocabulary.exampleSimple: You can expand this compact umbrella to cover a large table.

vocabulary.meaning: Instead of sth THAY VÌ CÁI GÌ ĐÓ
vocabulary.definition: Rather than
vocabulary.exampleSimple: I think I'd like to stay at home this evening rather than go out.

vocabulary.definition: Conventional farming
A natural substance that is used to make the ground more suitable for growing plants.
Compensate for sth
Created by people, as opposed to occurring in nature; artificial or synthetic.
Crop rotation
Not efficient; not producing the effect intended or desired; inefficacious
To toil, to work.

vocabulary.meaning: thải ra, phát ra (khí, gas, sound)
vocabulary.definition: To send out or give off
To refuse to accept.
vocabulary.exampleSimple: She even rejected my improved offer.

vocabulary.definition: To lead astray, in a false direction.
Dig sth up
vocabulary.exampleSimple: It's time we dig up those potatoes.

vocabulary.definition: A toxic or poisonous substance produced by the biological processes of biological organisms.
An identifying characteristic, habit or trend.
vocabulary.exampleSimple: The number one personality trait I hate is hypocrisy. Why can't you be consistent!?

vocabulary.definition: To pay, give in payment; repay, recompense; reward; requite.

vocabulary.meaning: tiếp cận cái gì đó, truy cập
vocabulary.definition: Gain access to sth
(usually with negative) Thus far; up to the present; up to some specified time; still
vocabulary.exampleSimple: He has never yet been late for an appointment;   I’m not yet wise enough to answer that;   Have you finished yet?

vocabulary.definition: To demand ownership of.

vocabulary.meaning: một ảnh hưởng rõ ràng đến cái gì đó
vocabulary.definition: A noticeable effect on sth
To add flavoring to something.
To use poison to kill or paralyse (somebody).
vocabulary.exampleSimple: Four members of the family had been poisoned

vocabulary.definition: To raise (someone) to a more important, responsible, or remunerative job or rank.
vocabulary.exampleSimple: He promoted his clerk to office manager.

vocabulary.definition: A mixture of mineral particles and organic material, used to support plant growth.

vocabulary.meaning: Khao khát, sự khao khát, ước muốn
vocabulary.definition: To want; to wish for earnestly.
vocabulary.exampleSimple: I certainly have no desire to have children.

vocabulary.definition: To determine with precision; to mark out with distinctness; to ascertain or exhibit clearly.
vocabulary.exampleSimple: the defining power of an optical instrument

vocabulary.definition: The practical aspects of a given art, occupation etc.; formal requirements.
The tendency to attract.
vocabulary.exampleSimple: The Moon is held in its orbit by the attraction of the Earth's gravity.

vocabulary.meaning: gần gũi, thân thiết với cái gì đó
vocabulary.definition: Close to sth/sb
Mother nature
To assess the similarities and differences between two or more things ["to compare X with Y"]. Having made the comparison of X with Y, one might have found it similar to Y or different from Y.
vocabulary.exampleSimple: Compare the tiger's coloration with that of the zebra.

vocabulary.definition: Very small.

vocabulary.meaning: sự ảnh hưởng lên cái gì đó
vocabulary.definition: Effect on something
(sometimes also used uncountably) A visible indication.
vocabulary.exampleSimple: I gave them a thumbs-up sign.

vocabulary.definition: (of food or drink) Providing nutrients; healthy to eat.
To change with time or a similar parameter.
vocabulary.exampleSimple: He varies his magic tricks so as to minimize the possibility that any given audience member will see the same trick twice.

vocabulary.definition: A plant, especially a cereal, grown to be harvested as food, livestock fodder or fuel or for any other economic purpose.
vocabulary.exampleSimple: the farmer had lots of crops to sell at the market

vocabulary.definition: Physical motion between points in space.
vocabulary.exampleSimple: I saw a movement in that grass on the hill.

vocabulary.definition: To point or direct a missile, or a weapon which propels as missile, towards an object or spot with the intent of hitting it
vocabulary.exampleSimple: He aimed at the target, but the arrow flew straight over it.

vocabulary.definition: To come or go near, in place or time; to draw nigh; to advance nearer.
Man-made; of artifice.
vocabulary.exampleSimple: The flowers were artificial, and he thought them rather tacky.

paragraphs.label: Intro
paragraphs.text: Today, many governments are promoting organic or natural farming methods that avoid the use of pesticides and other artificial products. The aim is to show that they care about the environment and about people's health. But is this the right approach?
paragraphs.translation: Ngày nay, nhiều chính phủ đang thúc đẩy các phương pháp canh tác hữu cơ hoặc tự nhiên nhằm tránh sử dụng thuốc trừ sâu và các sản phẩm nhân tạo khác. Mục đích là để cho thấy rằng họ quan tâm đến môi trường và sức khỏe con người. Nhưng liệu đây có phải là cách tiếp cận đúng đắn?
paragraphs.mainIdea: Many governments are promoting organic or natural farming methods to show they care about the environment and health

paragraphs.label: A
paragraphs.text: Europe is now the biggest market for organic food in the world, expanding by 25 percent a year over the past 10 years. So what is the attraction of organic food for some people? The really important thing is that organic sounds more "natural". Eating organic is a way of defining oneself as natural, good, caring. As someone said: 'It feels closer to the source, the beginning, the start of things.' The real desire of those who support organic food is to be somehow close to the soil, to Mother Nature.
paragraphs.translation: Europe is now the biggest market for organic food in the world, expanding by 25 percent a year over the past 10 years. So what is the attraction of organic food for some people? The really important thing is that organic sounds more "natural". Eating organic is a way of defining oneself as natural, good, caring. As someone said: 'It feels closer to the source, the beginning, the start of things.' The real desire of those who support organic food is to be somehow close to the soil, to Mother Nature.
paragraphs.mainIdea: The attraction of organic food is that it sounds more natural and makes people feel closer to Mother Nature

paragraphs.label: B
paragraphs.text: Unlike conventional farming, the organic approach means farming with natural, rather than man-made, fertilisers and pesticides. Techniques such as crop rotation improve soil quality and help organic farmers compensate for not using man-made chemicals. As a method of food production, organic is, however, inefficient in its use of labour and land. There are also severe limits to how much food can be produced. Also, the environmental benefits of not using artificial fertiliser are tiny compared with the amount of carbon dioxide emitted by transporting food.
paragraphs.translation: Unlike conventional farming, the organic approach means farming with natural, rather than man-made, fertilisers and pesticides. Techniques such as crop rotation improve soil quality and help organic farmers compensate for not using man-made chemicals. As a method of food production, organic is, however, inefficient in its use of labour and land. There are also severe limits to how much food can be produced. Also, the environmental benefits of not using artificial fertiliser are tiny compared with the amount of carbon dioxide emitted by transporting food.
paragraphs.mainIdea: Organic farming uses natural methods but is inefficient and has limited environmental benefits compared to food transportation emissions

paragraphs.label: C
paragraphs.text: Organic farming is often claimed to be safer than conventional farming - for the environment and for consumers. Yet studies into organic farming worldwide continue to reject this claim. A review by the UK Food Standards Agency found that there was no difference between organic and conventional crops. Even where results showed there was evidence of a difference, the reviewers found no sign that these differences would have any effect on health.
paragraphs.translation: Canh tác hữu cơ thường được cho là an toàn hơn canh tác thông thường - đối với môi trường và người tiêu dùng. Tuy nhiên, các nghiên cứu về canh tác hữu cơ trên toàn thế giới vẫn tiếp tục bác bỏ tuyên bố này. Một đánh giá của Cơ quan Tiêu chuẩn Thực phẩm Vương quốc Anh cho thấy không có sự khác biệt giữa cây trồng hữu cơ và cây trồng thông thường. Ngay cả khi kết quả cho thấy có bằng chứng về sự khác biệt, các nhà đánh giá không tìm thấy dấu hiệu nào cho thấy những khác biệt này có ảnh hưởng gì đến sức khỏe.
paragraphs.mainIdea: Studies reject the claim that organic farming is safer than conventional farming for the environment and consumers

paragraphs.label: D
paragraphs.text: The claim that organic food is more nutritious than conventional food was always likely to be misleading. Food is a natural product, and the health value of different foods will vary for a number of reasons, including freshness, the way the food is cooked, the type of soil it is grown in, the amount of sunlight and rain crops have received, and so on. Likewise, the flavour of a carrot depends less on whether it was fertilised than with the variety of carrot and how long ago it was dug up. The differences created by these things are likely to be greater than any differences brought about by using an organic or non-organic system of production.
paragraphs.translation: The claim that organic food is more nutritious than conventional food was always likely to be misleading. Food is a natural product, and the health value of different foods will vary for a number of reasons, including freshness, the way the food is cooked, the type of soil it is grown in, the amount of sunlight and rain crops have received, and so on. Likewise, the flavour of a carrot depends less on whether it was fertilised than with the variety of carrot and how long ago it was dug up. The differences created by these things are likely to be greater than any differences brought about by using an organic or non-organic system of production.
paragraphs.mainIdea: The claim that organic food is more nutritious is misleading because food's health value varies due to many factors beyond farming methods

paragraphs.label: E
paragraphs.text: The opinion that organic food is safer than 'normal' food is also rejected with the fact that many of our most common foods are full of natural toxins. As one research expert says: 'People think that the more natural something is, the better it is for them. That is simply not the case. In fact, the opposite is true: the closer a plant is to its natural state, the more likely it is that it will poison you. Naturally, many plants do not want to be eaten, so we have spent 10,000 years developing agriculture and eliminate harmful traits from crops.'
paragraphs.translation: The opinion that organic food is safer than 'normal' food is also rejected with the fact that many of our most common foods are full of natural toxins. As one research expert says: 'People think that the more natural something is, the better it is for them. That is simply not the case. In fact, the opposite is true: the closer a plant is to its natural state, the more likely it is that it will poison you. Naturally, many plants do not want to be eaten, so we have spent 10,000 years developing agriculture and eliminate harmful traits from crops.'
paragraphs.mainIdea: Organic food is not necessarily safer because many natural foods contain toxins, and agriculture has evolved to eliminate harmful traits

paragraphs.label: F
paragraphs.text: Ultimately, the organic farming movement is an expensive luxury for shoppers in Europe. To European people, the fact that organic methods require more labour and land than conventional ones to get the same yields may be not a problem, but to a farmer in rural Africa, it is a real problem. Here, it is just simply too expensive for building an organic farm. Perhaps the focus should be on helping these countries to gain access to the most advanced farming techniques, rather than trying to following worldwide organic trend.
paragraphs.translation: Ultimately, the organic farming movement is an expensive luxury for shoppers in Europe. To European people, the fact that organic methods require more labour and land than conventional ones to get the same yields may be not a problem, but to a farmer in rural Africa, it is a real problem. Here, it is just simply too expensive for building an organic farm. Perhaps the focus should be on helping these countries to gain access to the most advanced farming techniques, rather than trying to following worldwide organic trend.
paragraphs.mainIdea: Organic farming is an expensive luxury unsuitable for developing countries who need access to advanced farming techniques instead

fillInTheBlanks.instructions: Complete the sentences using the words from the box.

tasks.title: Task 2: Choose the most suitable word in the table to fill in the blanks

Although it seems like a natural river, it's a …………… river.
Generally, I prefer to go by train …………… fly to places.
